Aaron Swartz goes into some deep detail on how one might preserve data in the very long term.

I think about this whenever I come across something like a .sitx file, the previously ubitquitous wrapper for shareware on the Mac. One increasingly irrelevant company, StuffIt, makes the software to unarchive .sitx files, once they inevitably disappear and new operating systems come along incompatible with the latest versions of StuffIt Expander, the content inside .sitx files will imprisoned.

Just one of the many good reasons to avoid terrible proprietary formats like Word documents and PSDs and follow Alex Payne’s rules for computing happiness.
